channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: People who had received a third shot of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine showed a level of neutralization against the Omicron variant about 100 times higher than those who had received two shots, a new Israeli study found https://t.co/ezk3hMNCX8
Benedict Cumberbatch, Tom Blyth and Idris Elba are all British. And they’re all playing American cowboys. https://t.co/UMqD05O1ZC
It's OK if you don't really understand cryptocurrency. This is how it works. https://t.co/LoahdXZEBp
Inflation should be about 3% by the end of 2022, says the chair of the Council of Economic Advisers https://t.co/N4ml2hsiy4
The Turkish lira has plummeted, but so far the world’s biggest emerging markets have avoided contagion, explains @ahirtens #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/stWzsfg5WT
French President Emmanuel Macron and other public figures say that “woke” movements reflecting American ideas of multiculturalism threaten French society https://t.co/BPNB92KJgu

"I want to make it perfectly clear that I believe every single member of my Congress thinks getting vaccinated is a good idea. But mandating it is not going to work," Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell said of a federal vaccine mandate https://t.co/lZiNeTkZXW
Companies and governments around the world rushed over the weekend to fend off cyberattacks looking to exploit a serious flaw in a widely used piece of Internet software https://t.co/Ps3LzSzbl5
From @WSJopinion: Yes, the crime wave is as bad as you think. Progressives gaslight the public by claiming things used to be worse, writes @Rafa_Mangual https://t.co/Cci0SiskQ0
The United Arab Emirates is shifting to a 4½-day workweek that will start Monday and end on Friday at noon https://t.co/Pgxc9yFnFA
Vicente Fernández, the iconic Mexican king of the country’s traditional ranchera music, has died at age 81 https://t.co/yBC5jfr3Yp

Alibaba fired a female employee who had accused her supervisor of rape. Her accusations had triggered widespread debate about the prevalence of sexual misconduct in the workplace. https://t.co/IyFwlaf0AC
Due to the Amazon cloud outage, a couple had to "manually" feed their cats "like in ancient times" https://t.co/wYsNmyOHDf

Like Vincent van Gogh and Herman Melville, photographer Vivian Maier didn’t become well known until after her death. What does the posthumous triumph of artists tell us about the nature of fame? https://t.co/TireZ079jw
Your grandmother gave you cash in an envelope for the holidays. Should you consider giving her an NFT or cryptocurrency? https://t.co/fdVsCacWsm
Omicron was able to elude two doses of the Covid-19 vaccine from Pfizer and BioNTech in initial lab testing, but three doses neutralized the variant, the companies said https://t.co/lIsyzTLv0l
The Biden administration unveiled steps to combat corruption globally, including new rules on U.S. real-estate purchases to prevent money laundering https://t.co/k8dOqoz5lx
People warned an Olympic gold-medal skier to keep quiet about one of his great passions. He went public with it anyway: He’s a hunter. https://t.co/PsloJTQLje
Toyota is investing $1.25 billion and creating 1,750 jobs with a new electric-vehicle battery plant in rural Randolph County, N.C. https://t.co/8k0wLWlE5U
Chris Wallace, who announced he is leaving Fox News “to try something new,” is headed to CNN+, according to people familiar with the matter https://t.co/OBEDZVC2zu

Cybersecurity officials at major tech companies are scrambling to patch a serious flaw in a widely used piece of Internet software that security experts warn could unleash a new round of cyberattacks https://t.co/koO5rT9YzP

Rupert Murdoch purchased a 340,000-acre Montana cattle ranch from the Koch family for roughly $200 million, making it the largest ranch sale in state history, people with knowledge of the deal said https://t.co/YhI24oAVkA
Humanlike chatbots don’t help angry consumers. They just make them angrier. https://t.co/AShHOrXWb5
Anne Rice, the gothic novelist widely known for her bestselling novel “Interview with the Vampire,” died late Saturday at the age of 80 https://t.co/qJhvEBPYGU
Chris Wallace said he is leaving Fox News, ending an 18-year-run as host of “Fox News Sunday,” the network’s flagship weekend show https://t.co/ENuQGR6Mpx
At 80, Paul Simon isn’t interested in writing a memoir. Instead, his new audiobook offers a “musical biography” of his iconic song catalog. https://t.co/CjVtyuZYRZ
It's OK if you don't really understand cryptocurrency. This is how it works. https://t.co/ZR9QPdH3nP

People who had received a third shot of the Pfizer-BioNTech Covid-19 vaccine showed a level of neutralization against the Omicron variant about 100 times higher than those who had received two shots, a new Israeli study found https://t.co/YmkgUcx0Iv
Why Mark Zuckerberg may be wrong about the metaverse as the inevitable next paradigm shift in the digital world https://t.co/QHiPpC0QuY
Kentucky Gov. Andy Beshear said the number of deaths in his state could exceed 100 after a series of tornadoes ripped across parts of at least five states https://t.co/nS0ERcAFSz

Millennials, feeling their mortality during Covid-19, start writing their wills. “It was a game-changer when my wife asked me if I’d want to be put on a ventilator if I needed one.” https://t.co/lyMEc4smo3
Austria’s Covid-19 infections have plummeted and vaccination rates have soared after the country imposed a lockdown and said it would make the shots mandatory https://t.co/0TYCNdZNXx
Investors are pouring money into the meme-based cryptocurrency Shiba Inu. Watch as WSJ retail investing reporter Caitlin McCabe explains why: https://t.co/fc1Delyowx
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view, writes @mims https://t.co/xMD8qM0Ges

From @WSJopinion: I’m no longer confident the institute can ethically push the boundaries of science for the good of humanity while working with institutions beholden to the regime in China, writes Michelle Bethel https://t.co/Jbq49hFIqp
China wants to put its first Atlantic military base in Equatorial Guinea, U.S. intelligence shows. The prospect has set off alarm bells in Washington. https://t.co/Nx8AjaBHI5
Disappearing court documents, restricted access to data on ships and supplies: China closes off details about what’s happening inside the country https://t.co/uE1GZn4end

California Gov. Gavin Newsom wants to allow private citizens to sue gun manufacturers, modeling his proposal after the legal framework used in the Texas law banning abortions past six weeks https://t.co/E0Sddi1ere

How Elon Musk became a high-profile cheerleader of China's Communist Party https://t.co/Rqs94GdfCB
Quentin Durward, a neurosurgeon living in Dakota Dunes, S.D., has a 2020 Ford GT Heritage Edition that evokes the classic racers that beat Ferrari in the 1960s https://t.co/j6gXMBS9LH
At least 70 people have died, Kentucky’s governor estimated, after severe weather and tornadoes caused catastrophic damage across several states https://t.co/iC4dNHTnZ1
U.S. voters are pessimistic about the economy and short on confidence in President Biden’s leadership, a WSJ poll found https://t.co/eQhMCivdld

Essay: Hardships that hasten children’s cognitive development can harm their prospects as adults, according to recent research. What they need is the safety to play and explore. https://t.co/e8uVQFlHQd
